question: Domain of the function f, given by <katex>$f(x)=\frac{1}{\sqrt{(x-2)(x-5)}}$</katex> is
explanation: For <katex>$f(x)$</katex> to be defined, the term inside the square root must be strictly positive (since it is in the denominator).
Using the method of intervals (wavy curve method), the expression is positive when <katex>$x < 2$</katex> or <katex>$x > 5$</katex>.
